intro: Goniophlebium ciliatum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
